New Records: Zebby Matthews became the sixth Twins pitcher in team history to allow nine or more earned runs in two or fewer innings.
The 15-0 loss matched the second-largest margin of defeat in club history in a shutout loss.
The Twins allowed 23 hits, their most in a game since 2011.
Kyle Farmer set the Twins record for most innings pitched in a game by a position player, with two.
Key Match Events: Zebby Matthews was ambushed for nine runs in a two-inning start.
Toronto put up seven runs in the first inning, including two-run homers by Daulton Varsho and Spencer Horwitz, and a two-run double by Leo Jiménez.
Addison Barger hit a two-run blast in the second inning, ending Matthews' night.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Rocco Baldelli expressed confidence that the team would move on from the loss and emphasized the importance of learning from the experience.
Zebby Matthews acknowledged that he has a lot to learn and emphasized the importance of responding to setbacks.
